004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Volts;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.proto.SimpleMotorFeedforwardProto;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.struct.SimpleMotorFeedforwardStruct;
011import edu.wpi.first.units.Measure;
012import edu.wpi.first.units.Unit;
013import edu.wpi.first.units.Velocity;
014import edu.wpi.first.units.Voltage;
015import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
016import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
017
018/** A helper class that computes feedforward outputs for a simple permanent-magnet DC motor. */
019public class SimpleMotorFeedforward implements ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
020  /** The static gain. */
021  private final double ks;
022
023  /** The velocity gain. */
024  private final double kv;
025
026  /** The acceleration gain. */
027  private final double ka;
028
029  /** The period. */
030  private final double m_dt;
031
032  /**
033   * Creates a new SimpleMotorFeedforward with the specified gains and period. Units of the gain
034   * values will dictate units of the computed feedforward.
035   *
036   * @param ks The static gain.
037   * @param kv The velocity gain.
038   * @param ka The acceleration gain.
039   * @param dtSeconds The period in seconds.
040   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for kv &lt; zero.
041   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for ka &lt; zero.
042   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for period &le; zero.
043   */
044  public SimpleMotorFeedforward(double ks, double kv, double ka, double dtSeconds) {
045    this.ks = ks;
046    this.kv = kv;
047    this.ka = ka;
048    if (kv < 0.0) {
049      throw new IllegalArgumentException("kv must be a non-negative number, got " + kv + "!");
050    }
051    if (ka < 0.0) {
052      throw new IllegalArgumentException("ka must be a non-negative number, got " + ka + "!");
053    }
054    if (dtSeconds <= 0.0) {
055      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
056          "period must be a positive number, got " + dtSeconds + "!");
057    }
058    m_dt = dtSeconds;
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Creates a new SimpleMotorFeedforward with the specified gains and period. The period is
063   * defaulted to 20 ms. Units of the gain values will dictate units of the computed feedforward.
064   *
065   * @param ks The static gain.
066   * @param kv The velocity gain.
067   * @param ka The acceleration gain.
068   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for kv &lt; zero.
069   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for ka &lt; zero.
070   */
071  public SimpleMotorFeedforward(double ks, double kv, double ka) {
072    this(ks, kv, ka, 0.020);
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Creates a new SimpleMotorFeedforward with the specified gains. Acceleration gain is defaulted
077   * to zero. The period is defaulted to 20 ms. Units of the gain values will dictate units of the
078   * computed feedforward.
079   *
080   * @param ks The static gain.
081   * @param kv The velocity gain.
082   */
083  public SimpleMotorFeedforward(double ks, double kv) {
084    this(ks, kv, 0, 0.020);
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Returns the static gain.
089   *
090   * @return The static gain.
091   */
092  public double getKs() {
093    return ks;
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns the velocity gain.
098   *
099   * @return The velocity gain.
100   */
101  public double getKv() {
102    return kv;
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Returns the acceleration gain.
107   *
108   * @return The acceleration gain.
109   */
110  public double getKa() {
111    return ka;
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Returns the period.
116   *
117   * @return The period in seconds.
118   */
119  public double getDt() {
120    return m_dt;
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and setpoints.
125   *
126   * @param velocity The velocity setpoint.
127   * @param acceleration The acceleration setpoint.
128   * @return The computed feedforward.
129   * @deprecated Use the current/next velocity overload instead.
130   */
131  @SuppressWarnings("removal")
132  @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "2025")
133  public double calculate(double velocity, double acceleration) {
134    return ks * Math.signum(velocity) + kv * velocity + ka * acceleration;
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and velocity setpoint (acceleration is assumed to be
139   * zero).
140   *
141   * @param velocity The velocity setpoint.
142   * @return The computed feedforward.
143   * @deprecated Use the current/next velocity overload instead.
144   */
145  @SuppressWarnings("removal")
146  @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "2025")
147  public double calculate(double velocity) {
148    return calculate(velocity, 0);
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and setpoints assuming discrete control when the
153   * setpoint does not change.
154   *
155   * @param <U> The velocity parameter either as distance or angle.
156   * @param setpoint The velocity setpoint.
157   * @return The computed feedforward.
158   */
159  public <U extends Unit<U>> Measure<Voltage> calculate(Measure<Velocity<U>> setpoint) {
160    return calculate(setpoint, setpoint);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and setpoints assuming discrete control.
165   *
166   * @param <U> The velocity parameter either as distance or angle.
167   * @param currentVelocity The current velocity setpoint.
168   * @param nextVelocity The next velocity setpoint.
169   * @return The computed feedforward.
170   */
171  public <U extends Unit<U>> Measure<Voltage> calculate(
172      Measure<Velocity<U>> currentVelocity, Measure<Velocity<U>> nextVelocity) {
173    if (ka == 0.0) {
174      // Given the following discrete feedforward model
175      //
176      //   uₖ = B_d⁺(rₖ₊₁ − A_d rₖ)
177      //
178      // where
179      //
180      //   A_d = eᴬᵀ
181      //   B_d = A⁻¹(eᴬᵀ - I)B
182      //   A = −kᵥ/kₐ
183      //   B = 1/kₐ
184      //
185      // We want the feedforward model when kₐ = 0.
186      //
187      // Simplify A.
188      //
189      //   A = −kᵥ/kₐ
190      //
191      // As kₐ approaches zero, A approaches -∞.
192      //
193      //   A = −∞
194      //
195      // Simplify A_d.
196      //
197      //   A_d = eᴬᵀ
198      //   A_d = exp(−∞)
199      //   A_d = 0
200      //
201      // Simplify B_d.
202      //
203      //   B_d = A⁻¹(eᴬᵀ - I)B
204      //   B_d = A⁻¹((0) - I)B
205      //   B_d = A⁻¹(-I)B
206      //   B_d = -A⁻¹B
207      //   B_d = -(−kᵥ/kₐ)⁻¹(1/kₐ)
208      //   B_d = (kᵥ/kₐ)⁻¹(1/kₐ)
209      //   B_d = kₐ/kᵥ(1/kₐ)
210      //   B_d = 1/kᵥ
211      //
212      // Substitute these into the feedforward equation.
213      //
214      //   uₖ = B_d⁺(rₖ₊₁ − A_d rₖ)
215      //   uₖ = (1/kᵥ)⁺(rₖ₊₁ − (0) rₖ)
216      //   uₖ = kᵥrₖ₊₁
217      return Volts.of(ks * Math.signum(nextVelocity.magnitude()) + kv * nextVelocity.magnitude());
218    } else {
219      //   uₖ = B_d⁺(rₖ₊₁ − A_d rₖ)
220      //
221      // where
222      //
223      //   A_d = eᴬᵀ
224      //   B_d = A⁻¹(eᴬᵀ - I)B
225      //   A = −kᵥ/kₐ
226      //   B = 1/kₐ
227      double A = -kv / ka;
228      double B = 1.0 / ka;
229      double A_d = Math.exp(A * m_dt);
230      double B_d = 1.0 / A * (A_d - 1.0) * B;
231      return Volts.of(
232          ks * Math.signum(currentVelocity.magnitude())
233              + 1.0 / B_d * (nextVelocity.magnitude() - A_d * currentVelocity.magnitude()));
234    }
235  }
236
237  /**
238   * Calculates the maximum achievable velocity given a maximum voltage supply and an acceleration.
239   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
240   * simultaneously achievable - enter the acceleration constraint, and this will give you a
241   * simultaneously-achievable velocity constraint.
242   *
243   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the motor.
244   * @param acceleration The acceleration of the motor.
245   * @return The maximum possible velocity at the given acceleration.
246   */
247  public double maxAchievableVelocity(double maxVoltage, double acceleration) {
248    // Assume max velocity is positive
249    return (maxVoltage - ks - acceleration * ka) / kv;
250  }
251
252  /**
253   * Calculates the minimum achievable velocity given a maximum voltage supply and an acceleration.
254   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
255   * simultaneously achievable - enter the acceleration constraint, and this will give you a
256   * simultaneously-achievable velocity constraint.
257   *
258   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the motor.
259   * @param acceleration The acceleration of the motor.
260   * @return The minimum possible velocity at the given acceleration.
261   */
262  public double minAchievableVelocity(double maxVoltage, double acceleration) {
263    // Assume min velocity is negative, ks flips sign
264    return (-maxVoltage + ks - acceleration * ka) / kv;
265  }
266
267  /**
268   * Calculates the maximum achievable acceleration given a maximum voltage supply and a velocity.
269   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
270   * simultaneously achievable - enter the velocity constraint, and this will give you a
271   * simultaneously-achievable acceleration constraint.
272   *
273   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the motor.
274   * @param velocity The velocity of the motor.
275   * @return The maximum possible acceleration at the given velocity.
276   */
277  public double maxAchievableAcceleration(double maxVoltage, double velocity) {
278    return (maxVoltage - ks * Math.signum(velocity) - velocity * kv) / ka;
279  }
280
281  /**
282   * Calculates the minimum achievable acceleration given a maximum voltage supply and a velocity.
283   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
284   * simultaneously achievable - enter the velocity constraint, and this will give you a
285   * simultaneously-achievable acceleration constraint.
286   *
287   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the motor.
288   * @param velocity The velocity of the motor.
289   * @return The minimum possible acceleration at the given velocity.
290   */
291  public double minAchievableAcceleration(double maxVoltage, double velocity) {
292    return maxAchievableAcceleration(-maxVoltage, velocity);
293  }
294
295  /** SimpleMotorFeedforward struct for serialization. */
296  public static final SimpleMotorFeedforwardStruct struct = new SimpleMotorFeedforwardStruct();
297
298  /** SimpleMotorFeedforward protobuf for serialization. */
299  public static final SimpleMotorFeedforwardProto proto = new SimpleMotorFeedforwardProto();
300}
